author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chennai Metrowater resumed piped water supply to parts of the city’s southern areas last week after the major work to repair the main water pipeline in Kotturpuram was completed.

Some of the areas that will have a better piped water supply are Mylapore, Alwarpet, CIT Colony, R.A. Puram, Mandaveli, Santhome, Pattinapakkam and Nandanam. Nearly 50 workers were involved in repairing the pipeline that sunk along the Adyar river near Kotturpuram during the recent floods.

Water supply was disrupted as the pipeline from MRC Nagar water distribution station was damaged.

The complex work to repair the 45-metre long pipelines with 110-millimetre diameter was carried out for over 10 days, officials said.
title: Water supply resumes in south Chennai
